intro: Aureolaria rupestris, commonly known as the rock aureole, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Legume family (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being narrow and slightly hairy. The flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
